posts.content:
Dark Warden (BG4, Ranger26, Fighter10)
By Tyr Templar

Concept: The Dark Warden is a skilled trapper and hunter, with a love of the great outdoors, the fresh mountain air, the sound of water rushing down the stream, and a preference for hunting animals of the two-legged variety: man-kind.

Pros and Cons:
Warden has a very good (high) AB (Naked 44+2 Bane: 46 / Buffed: AB 52, +3 Smite) and nothing short of exciting damage output [STR-based, Fighter WS/EWS along with Ranger buffs and BoE, BG Bull’s (which stacks with Bull’s potions) and Divine Might, with a bit of sneak damage, too—lethal!]. Double-weapon focus as well—namely, Scimitar (single wield/board, in full dress battle gear) and the Double-Axe (dual wield/large double-bladed weapon with a /x3 crit factor), with Divine Shield for propping up defense when dual-wielding such that, albeit offensive-based (the dead don't strike back, eh?), defense has not been overlooked (i.e. DS with Cat’s fully covers off the difference between heavy and light armor, just add CHA and/or DEX for more, which CHA will further and in addition raise not only saves (Dark Blessing) but also damage (DM), with DS also providing a nice boost of course when/if in full plate/battle dress gear, too).

Skills are decent, having everything a good…er…evil warden really needs, including deadly traps for added flavor and versatility (not to mention deadly). While Warden has a nice (good) fort, rest are decent, and has Dark Blessing (which Blessing and/or clarity potions you'll want to use and shore up that will save).

Other Combos:
As if all of that wasn’t enough, turns out that not only is Warden the first to make use of the BG/Ranger/Fighter combo according to the Pulse/search engine, but also appears to be the first to bring Ranger dual-wield and BG Divine Might / Divine Shield together as well, meaning the double-bladed Warden is doubly unique (or is that triply so, as did I mention a double weapon specialization, too? ). Without any further ado, please meet:


Dark Warden (BG4, Ranger26, Fighter10)

I Attributes:
STR: 16 (30)
DEX: 8
CON: 12
WIS: 14
INT: 8
CHA: 16

Human, Evil (theme: CE)

II Level Guide:
01: Ranger(1): weapon proficiency exotic, power attack, favored enemy I, {Dual Wield}
02: Fighter(1): cleave
03: Fighter(2): weapon focus: scimitar, weapon focus: double axe

05: Ranger(2)

07: Ranger(4)

09: Ranger(6): blind fight
10: Blackguard(1)
11: Blackguard(2): {Smite Good}
12: Fighter(4): STR+1, weapon specialization: scimitar, weapon specialization: double axe, (STR=19)
13: Ranger(7)
14: Ranger(8)

16: Ranger(9): STR+1, {Improved Two-Weapon Fighting}, (STR=20)
17: Ranger(10): favored enemy III

19: Ranger(11)

22: Fighter(7)
23: Ranger(12)

25: Ranger(13)
26: Ranger(14)

28: Ranger(16): STR+1, (STR=24)
29: Ranger(17)

31: Ranger(19)

38: Ranger(24)
39: Ranger(25): great strength IV, favored enemy VI, (STR=29)
40: Ranger(26): STR+1, favored enemy VII, (STR=30)

*Weapon Note: Scimitar taken for its crit. Factor (also enabling board (and plate, too) thus, AC), with double-axe (large, double-bladed) chosen as it not only looks right (BG’s wield big axes, one blade being nice, but double blade always better) but also because it works with Blade Thirst (requires slashing weapon) and has a /x3 crit. factor (nice for taking down the “big boss”, etc., and with 6 apr (7 apr hasted), with all the damage of course chews through enemies like there's no tomorrow, too). Another double-bladed weapon to consider is the Two-Bladed Sword, also large, double-bladed slashing weapon with a better crit. range (17-20/x2; Keen: 15-20) than has the double-axe, but only a /x2 multiplier in which case might consider swapping out the scimmy for bastard sword instead. Otherwise, apart from Blade Thirst requirements (slashing weapon), weapons are a matter of personal choice, most true.

---

III. Basics:

a. Hitpoints: 440 (448)

b. Saving Throws (v Spells):
Fort 29 (31)
Will: 20 (22)
Reflex: 17, +2 Cat’s: 19 (21)

Other: Ranger Spells (i.e., Freedom, etc.), Dark Blessing


IV. Combat Vitals:
BAB: 30, AB: 44, +2 Bane: 46 (melee), +3 Smite Good (-2 dual wield)
Self-Buffed (+2 BG Bull’s, +1 Aid, +3 Blade Thirst): 52, +3 Smite: 55 (-2 dual)

Damage:

i) Mundane Scimitar (Medium/Slashing):
1-6+16, +8-18 FEs, +2 Bull’s, +3 Thirst , +3 Divine (DM), +5 PA* (crit: 15-20/x2) (12-20/x2 keen), +1d6 Sneak

ii) Mundane Double-Axe (Large/Double-Sided; Slashing):
Main-Hand: 1-8+16, +8-18 FEs, +2 Bull’s, +3 Thirst, +3 Divine, +5 PA* (crit: 19-20/x3) (18-20/x3 keen), +1d6 Sneak
Off-Hand: 1-8+11, +8-18 FEs, +1 Bull’s, +3 Thirst, +3 Divine, +5 PA* (crit: 19-20/x3) (18-20/x3 keen), +1d6 Sneak

Note: PA Mode (-5 ab), adds +5 Damage (Scimitar)/+10 Damage (Double-Axe).
Other: Animal Companion (Panther or Bear); Smite Bonus, +4; DM (enhance with Charisma); Deadly Traps.

V. Defense Vitals: AC (naked): 15
Dual-Wield/Leather: 15, +3 studded leather, +2 Cat’s: 20, +3 Divine Shield: 23 AC
Full “Battle Dress” (Single Wield/Shield): 15, +8 Plate, +3 Tower: 26, +2 Cat's, +3 Divine Shield: 31

Other: Ranger Spells (Grease, Ultravision, Purge Invis.); DS (enhance with Charisma).


VI. Spell Casting: Ranger(4)

VII. Skillpoints: 144*
Deadly Trap Set: Disable Trap 1(2), Discipline 43(53,+2 BG Bull's: 55), Hide 5(4) (BG prereq.), Set Trap 32(31,+2 Cat's,+4 One.w.Land: 37), Spellcraft 11(10), Tumble 20(19)

Alternate--Detect Set: Discipline 43(53,+2 BG Bull's: 55), Heal 1(3), Hide 5(5)(BG prereq), Listen 43(45,+6 FE: 51; Ranger Ultravision, Purge Invis.), Spellcraft 6(5), Tumble 20(19)

*Players should feel free to adjust their Dark Warden to suit their preferences/environs, as always.
